intro: Helianthemum greenei, commonly known as the Greene's rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a low-growing shrub with fleshy, evergreen leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and drought tolerance. Helianthemum greenei is often found in chaparral and desert scrub habitats.
